oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bowie Knife
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This side knife or Bowie knife was made in Holladay, Benton County, Tennessee. The knife appears to be hand made and has a wooden handle and a crude, metal guard. Many homemade knives were carried off to war by volunteer soldiers in 1861. The soldiers; soon realized that the cumbersome Bowie knives were of little use on a Civil War battlefield. Many soldiers simply discarded the weapon while others sent them back home for safe keeping.
